trans-unit.source: Continues an enumeration of network resources

seg-source.mrk: Continues an enumeration of network resources

target.mrk: Continues an enumeration of network resources

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle that identifies an enumeration instance. The handle is returned by the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function.

seg-source.mrk: Handle that identifies an enumeration instance.
The handle is returned by the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function.

target.mrk: Handle that identifies an enumeration instance.
The handle is returned by the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function.

trans-unit.source: Number of entries requested. If the number requested is –1, the function returns as many entries as possible.

seg-source.mrk: Number of entries requested.
If the number requested is –1, the function returns as many entries as possible.

target.mrk: Number of entries requested.
If the number requested is –1, the function returns as many entries as possible.

trans-unit.source: If the function succeeds, on return the variable contains the number of entries actually read.

seg-source.mrk: If the function succeeds, on return the variable contains the number of entries actually read.

target.mrk: If the function succeeds, on return the variable contains the number of entries actually read.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to the buffer that receives the enumeration results.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to the buffer that receives the enumeration results.

target.mrk: Pointer to the buffer that receives the enumeration results.

trans-unit.source: The results are returned as an array of $tagNETRESOURCE structures.

seg-source.mrk: The results are returned as an array of $tagNETRESOURCE structures.

target.mrk: The results are returned as an array of $tagNETRESOURCE structures.

trans-unit.source: The buffer must be large enough to hold the structures plus the strings to which their members point.

seg-source.mrk: The buffer must be large enough to hold the structures plus the strings to which their members point.

target.mrk: The buffer must be large enough to hold the structures plus the strings to which their members point.

trans-unit.source: The buffer is valid until the next call using the handle specified by $hEnum.

seg-source.mrk: The buffer is valid until the next call using the handle specified by $hEnum.

target.mrk: The buffer is valid until the next call using the handle specified by $hEnum.

trans-unit.source: The order of $tagNETRESOURCE structures in the array is not predictable.

seg-source.mrk: The order of $tagNETRESOURCE structures in the array is not predictable.

target.mrk: The order of $tagNETRESOURCE structures in the array is not predictable.

trans-unit.source: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

target.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: If the buffer is too small to receive even one entry, this parameter receives the required size of the buffer.

seg-source.mrk: If the buffer is too small to receive even one entry, this parameter receives the required size of the buffer.

target.mrk: If the buffer is too small to receive even one entry, this parameter receives the required size of the buffer.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: True.

target.mrk: True.

seg-source.mrk: False.

target.mrk: False.

target.mrk: Related
